item.title: PostgreSQL Installation and DB Creation on Ubuntu 16.04
item.author: Sayef
item.description: Installation Note: This installation procedure is based on Ubuntu 16.04, for other versions see [https://www.postgresql.org/download/linux/ubuntu/] Create the file /etc/apt/sources.list.d/pgdg.list, and add a line for the repository 1 $ echo "deb http://apt.postgresql.org/pub/repos/apt/ xenial-pgdg main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/pgdg.list Import the repository signing key, and update the package lists 1 $ wget --quiet -O - https://www.postgresql.org/media/keys/ACCC4CF8.asc | sudo apt-key add - Ubuntu includes PostgreSQL by default. To install PostgreSQL on Ubuntu, use the apt-get (or other apt-driving) command 1 2 $ sudo apt-get update $ sudo apt-get install postgresql-9.
